intro: Thrincia taraxacoides, commonly known as the yellow starbursh, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Thrincia taraxacoides is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
